column3: UCD School of Agriculture and Food Science
column5: Graduate Taught (level 9 nfq, credits 90)The MSc Sustainable Agriculture and Rural Development responds to the new agenda for agriculture and rural area development. It represents a return to core values in the development of rural areas which are rooted in agricultural change as well as responding to new societal demands such as safe and ethically produced food, a healthier environment and sustainable and affordable energy. These issues are relevant in both Ireland, industrialised countries and in the developing world.
column7: Please see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
